titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Elizabeth Aiken Freund graduated from Bryn Mawr in 1939. She received her master's degree in City Planning from the University of Pennsylvania in 1956. She worked for many years with the New York City Housing Authority, helping to organize a union there.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of the papers of Elizabeth Freund. Materials include: notes and letters from Freund's time at Aberdeen Camp, an American Friends Service Committee resettlement camp for war refugees in the 1930s; correspondence relating to Hilda Worthington Smith's autobiography, which Freund helped edit; a transcription of interviews on a planned oral history of worker's education in the United States; and notes and drafts of Walter Baumgartel's Up Among the Mountain Gorillas (1976), which Freund helped him edit. The Baumgartel materials also include copies of Baumgartel's correspondence with Dian Fossey, as well as correspondence between Baumgartel and Freund. The collection also contains a thesis by Gene Bruce Milgram on New York's "Scatter-site" public housing program and a series of audiotape recordings of Freund, Hilda Smith, and Walter Baumgartel.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Bryn Mawr College: Hilda Worthington Smith papers.
